name: Turn Based Strategy Game Prototype
description:
It's turn based strategy game. Currently no AI has been developed so you have to play with yourself. 

  1. After units for each side is chosen you're brought to the grid for setting up unit locations,
  2. The screen can be zoomed in with the mouse scroll wheel and the screen can be moved by dragging the mouse while pressing the scroll wheel.  
  3. The lines represent how far each player can place their units. The colored circle on the top right shows which players turn it is. A unit's faction can be distinguished by their flag colors.   Red = player 1, blue = player 2.
  4. To move units, move the white flag to the desired space. A unit can be deselected by clicking on an invalid space (outside the grid/ pass the line). Selecting a unit while another unit is selected will switch the selected unit to the one that has been newly selected. Moving the unit will also deselect it.  
  5. Clicking the white button switches to player 2 so they can then move their units around. After player two clicks the white button, the game will start. 
  6. The selected unit  is highlighted at the bottom box, health (green bar) and action points (red bar) are shown and open their action tabs.  A units actions are move, defend, form, and reset.  Their are multiple move actions, these actions are walk, run, and charge. Walk move to the desired location and preform an attack on surrounding enemies, run move to want location further to walk but do no attack, charge move to desire location attacking enemies in their path.  Defend puts them in defend mode.  Form changes the unit direction and formation (square or line).
  7. The order in which units do their actions can be changed with the bottom box. This is done by dragging the unit around the box. The health bars of each unit are also shown in this box
